title: Let's Discuss the Boards
body:
I'm here to welcome any topic pertaining to the Boards, be it rules, features, questions, etc. 

What questions do you have? What features would you like to see? How can we improve your Boards experience?

replies.body:
1: Make using images/gifs easier. Its annoying that some sites work and others don’t for no apparent reason. 

2: Megathreads instead of 10 of the same posts take up all the space on hot section.

3: this one is ambitious: mobile app xd
I second a mobile app idea, doubt we'll ever get it but it'd be neat.

I vote no on megathreads. If I want to start a discussion on something, I don't want to be forced to bury it in a pile of shite because someone else posted about something only vaguely related. Instead, why not just change the sorting algorithm so topics only stay in hot for a shorter period of time?

The problem is that currently you get like 5+ virtually identical threads with no added substance whatsoever. It's one thing if you make a post saying "X is OP because of these researched facts, let me explain", but most threads that end up on Hot are just "X is OP gut pls".

Then how 'bout instead of restricting the people thinking their threads through, we just start removing all the no-effort "X is OP shit nerf plz wtf RIOT" threads? Either that or maybe the mods can actually do something with their Gamplay+ idea that seems to have gone nowhere; either start actually moving threads in there that meet the criteria, or loosen the restrictions and make them the standard for regular Gameplay.

* Have the Post Preview render images.
* Fix syntax handling when creating posts (> quote gets turned into &gt; and thus doesn't get formatted correctly until you edit and change back to >)
* Improved editing for large posts. Right now it shrinks down to the smallest size, making it very challenging to edit.
* Auto Save posts/replies while they're being drafted.
* Better table support (easier to make, less manual)
* More stickers
* Format the hover over preview from Boards home so you don't have "Seriously, \{{champion:123}} is out of hand, isn&apos;t it time they got nerfed?"
* Add the HTML so mobile browsers (particularly Chrome) can have the URL bar match the dark theme of the website.
* Fix GD so when you click on the next page it takes you to the *start* of the next page instead of the end.
* Fix GD so when you click a reply notification you're taken to the correct part (it currently shows the discussions page count as pages - 1, and takes you to whatever page you were on - 1)

Edit: I almost forgot, can we get an *actual* search feature? Half the time it returns posts which don't match what you searched for, and clicking the "show more" at the bottom clears out your search parameters.

Posts are a crazy mix of HTML, markdown, and extra syntax (like the champion:nnn things). Post text is HTML-escaped, and only unescaped in the actual rendered post - not in the hover preview, not in quoted text. It's pretty bad. Also, speaking of the champion:nnn syntax, it breaks search (if you want to know about {{champion:266}}, do you search for Aatrox or the number 266?), and provides nothing in return other than pretty pictures. It doesn't even pop a tooltip when you hover - not even the _name_ of the thing, much less an item's stats, champion's abilities, etc.

When you click through to the next page of a discussion in chronological view (not just GD), the new discussion page is not actually taking you to a new web page; it's just replacing the post elements with new posts, without automatically jumping to the top reply. I kind of can't believe no one caught that in testing. It reminds me of reading ebooks by traversing memo entries backwards on my Palm Pilot IIIxe nearly 20 years ago.
It's actually crazy how it's been 10 months since I made this post. I'm getting back to the swing of things, so hopefully I'll do ya proud.

A few suggestions I've had in mind:

* **Ability to hide certain boards/user discussions.** A lot of us would feel much better if we could see everything *but* Gameplay, or not have to see specific user's discussions due to whatever reason.

* **More user-friendly image uploading.** Either give us an easy walkthrough on how to do it when we're making a post, or just let us directly upload the images/videos. 

* **Forbid multiple discussions on near-identical topics.** We don't need 6 people with separate threads on how Yasuo's W is OP all on hot at once. Mandate they make it into a single thread, so that actually good content can be seen, instead of having to wade through dozens of shitty posts.

 * On a related note, can we also get slightly stricter moderation/rules on zero-effort/deliberately inaccurate threads? It's one thing to have 6 "Yasuo's W is OP, and here's the reasons why" threads, it's another for all 6 to basically be "Yasuo's W is OP because it blocks stuff" or "Yasuo's W is OP nerf now!".

* **Let mods move threads to different boards.** Also let the person who made the thread move it, too.

* **PMs/DMs on boards, and ability to follow specific users**. Let us see when a specific person posts a new thread (and/or comment), and let us talk to people through this.
